description: Oksana Lintz faces a critical choice between leaking the full evidence of BCI abuses or triggering Halden’s lullaby protocol. After late-night reflection and a conversation with colleague Alex, she decides to guide the city through structured restoration instead of igniting mass chaos.

A citywide broadcast of Halden's lullaby begins, woven with cryptic prompts and ethical challenges. Neighborhoods are invited to debate hidden messages and unlock gradual access to BCI administrative controls.

As districts decipher the lullaby’s patterns, select groups gain access to BCI features. Local assemblies form to debate whether to restore the BCI as before, implement reforms, or risk adopting a fully transparent civic system.

District assemblies hold open-air debates, weighing the risks of centralized safety against the allure—and uncertainty—of collective power. Halden’s ambiguous legacy and BCI’s flaws dominate heated discussions.

A citywide referendum unfolds: residents must vote to either reform and restore the old BCI or transition to a new, transparent governance model. The outcome will define Stenograd’s future governance and social structure.
